column4: sin2gen, all it will take is one manufacturere to say "Don't worry, if you have linux, we got you covered!"
When the other companies start losing money, then the whole shift will occour
You can sell a P4 computer with Ubuntu for $300 - $400, and make a profit out of older gear that (the other company) can no longer use..
Really? Interesting, talk about a slap in the face of gates...lol
It was a junker P-2, 64 Meg ram, and a 10 Gig Hdd..
But Linux runs like a dream on it..
<~~ the oddball here, Using Fedora KDE and hanging out in Ubuntu chat...lol
slavik'lap: Ubuntu gives this computer hell, for some reason...lol
dude, I only buy cheep keyboards. Even the best keyboard is not beer proof
well, I didn't look at the keyboard when I bought it, it had the old style (huge) connection on it, instead of PS2, so I had to use that huge adapter and all that...
ahh, an AT keyboard, I think I have one of those somewhere
well, needless to say, Gene learned a lesson not to buy anything without lookin at it.. lol
haha, I think we have all done that, gene. it's kind of like marrying a woman without "knowing" her first
does this mean I should cancel my russian bride service? ;-)
I am not one to discourage brining new breeding stock into this country...
